traits.smithy.api#documentation: Savings Plans are a pricing model that offer significant savings on AWS usage (for example, on Amazon EC2 instances). You commit to a consistent amount of usage, in USD per hour, for a term of 1 or 3 years, and receive a lower price for that usage. For more information, see the AWS Savings Plans User Guide.
Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
The hourly commitment, in USD. This is a value between 0.001 and 1 million. You cannot specify more than three digits after the decimal point.
The up-front payment amount. This is a whole number between 50 and 99 percent of the total value of the Savings Plan. This parameter is supported only if the payment option is Partial Upfront.
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve additional results, make another call with the returned token value.
The token for the next page of results.
The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
Describes the specified Savings Plans offering rates.
